framed.bioreactor package¶

Submodules¶

framed.bioreactor.base module¶

This module defines the base classes used for modeling and analyzing bioreactors

Author: Kai Zhuang

class framed.bioreactor.base.Bioreactor(organisms=[], metabolites=[], id='Generic Bioreactor', flow_rate_in=0, flow_rate_out=0, volume_max=None, Xfeed=None, Sfeed=None, deltaX=None, deltaS=None, initial_conditions=[])¶

Bases: framed.bioreactor.base.Environment, framed.bioreactor.base.DynamicSystem

This class describes a generic bioreactor with one influent (feed) stream and one effluent stream

calculate_productivity_from_dfba()¶

Abstract used for calculating productivity from dFBA solution. This is useful for certain analysis methods (eg. DySScO).

This should be implemented for specific bioreactors

calculate_titer_from_dfba()¶

Abstract used for calculating product titer from dFBA solution. This is useful for certain analysis methods (eg. DySScO).

This should be implemented for specific bioreactors

calculate_yield_from_dfba()¶

Abstract used for calculating product yield from dFBA solution. This is useful for certain analysis methods (eg. DySScO).

This should be implemented for specific bioreactors

set_Sfeed(Sfeed)¶
set_Xfeed(Xfeed)¶
set_deltaS(deltaS)¶
set_deltaX(deltaX)¶
set_initial_conditions(Vinit, Xinit, Sinit)¶
set_metabolites(metabolites, Sfeed=None, deltaS=None)¶
set_organisms(organisms, Xfeed=None, deltaX=None)¶
update(time)¶
class framed.bioreactor.base.DynamicSystem¶

Bases: object

This class describes a generic dynamic system

analytical_integrator(t0, tf, dt, initial_conditions, solver, verbose)¶

the analytical_integrator() method integrates the ODE of the dynamic system using a user-defined analytical method

** this is an abstract method, must be implemented for specific dynamic systems **

integrate(t0, tf, dt, initial_conditions, solver, verbose=False)¶

the integrate() solves the ODE of the dynamic system using the designated solver :param t0: initial time :param tf: final time :param dt: time step :param initial_conditions (array-like): initial conditions of the ODE system :param solver: the designated solver :return:

numerical_integrator(t0, tf, dt, initial_conditions, solver, verbose)¶

the numerical_integrator() method integrates the ODE of the dynamic system using a numerical solver

ode_RHS(y, t)¶

this is the Right Hand Side of the system of ODE that describe the dynamic multi-species system :param y: state variables such as liquid volume, biomass concentrations, and metabolite concentrations :param t: time :return:

** this is an abstract method, must be implemented for specific environments **

class framed.bioreactor.base.Environment¶

Bases: object

This class describes a generic environment that contains a number of organisms and metabolites

add_metabolite(metabolite)¶
add_metabolites(metabolites)¶
add_organism(organism)¶
add_organisms(organisms)¶
set_metabolites(metabolites)¶
set_organisms(organisms)¶
update()¶

The update() method is used to change the internal state of the environment. This method is called at each integration step.

** this is an abstract method, must be implemented for specific environments **

class framed.bioreactor.base.Organism(model, id=None, fba_objective=None, fba_constraints={}, model_deepcopy=True)¶

Bases: object

Organism describes a generic biological organism.

update()¶

The update() method is used to change the internal state of the organism. - This method is called at each integration step. - One usage of this method is to describe how the FBA uptake constraint changes in response to the changes in

the metabolite concentrations.

** this is an abstract method, must be implemented in strain specific subclasses **

framed.bioreactor.bioreactors module¶

This module defines classes for commonly used bioreactor types subclassed from Bioreactor

@author: Kai Zhuang

class framed.bioreactor.bioreactors.Bioreactor_ox(organisms=[], metabolites=[], id='Generic Bioreactor', flow_rate_in=0, flow_rate_out=0, volume_max=None, Xfeed=None, Sfeed=None, deltaX=None, deltaS=None, initial_conditions=[], oxygen_availability=None)¶

Bases: framed.bioreactor.base.Bioreactor

Bioreactor class with oxygen_availability flag

class framed.bioreactor.bioreactors.IdealBatch(organisms=[], metabolites=[], id='IdealBatch', volume_max=None, deltaX=None, deltaS=None, initial_conditions=[], oxygen_availability=None)¶

Bases: framed.bioreactor.bioreactors.Bioreactor_ox

This class describes an ideal batch reactor.
  • flow_rate_in, flow_rate_out, Xfeed, Sfeed are all set to zero (no feeding in batch reactor).
calculate_yield_from_dfba(dfba_solution, r_substrate, r_product)¶

calculates the product yield from dFBA solution

class framed.bioreactor.bioreactors.IdealFedbatch(organisms=[], metabolites=[], id='IdealFedbatch', primary_substrate=None, volume_max=None, Xfeed=None, Sfeed=None, deltaX=None, deltaS=None, initial_conditions=[], oxygen_availability=None)¶

Bases: framed.bioreactor.bioreactors.Bioreactor_ox

This class describes an ideal fedbatch reactor with a single primary substrate.
  • The flow_rate_in is automatically adjusted using the following rules:
    • otherwise, calculates flow_rate_in so that substrate concentration is maintained (d_substrate/dt = 0)
  • The primary substrate (usually the carbon & energy source) can be specified in the __init__() method. If it is not specified, the first element of metabolites is assumed to be the substrate
update(time)¶
calculates the flow_rate_in of the fedbatch reactor is calculated here.
  • if liquid volume >= volume_max, then the tank is full, set flow_rate_in to zero
  • otherwise, calculate the flow rate so that d_substrate/dt = 0
Parameters:(float) (time) – the simulation time. can be used in subclasses to trigger time-specific events

framed.bioreactor.dfba module¶

This module implements the Dynamic Flux Balance Analysis with support for multi-organism communities. This multi-organism version of the dFBA is derived from the Dynamic Multi-species Metabolic Modeling (DyMMM) framework.

For dFBA, please cite:
Mahadevan et al. 2002. Dynamic flux balance analysis of diauxic growth in Escherichia coli.
For DyMMM, please cite:
Zhuang et al. 2011. Genome-scale dynamic modeling of the competition between Rhodoferax and Geobacter in anoxic
subsurface environments.
Zhuang et al. 2012. The design of long-term effective uranium bioremediation strategy using a community metabolic
model.

@TODO: implement the analytical solver

@author: Kai Zhuang

framed.bioreactor.dfba.DyMMM() is a alias for dFBAm()¶

It is intended to provide legacy support for the name “DyMMM”

framed.bioreactor.dfba.dFBA(bioreactor, t0, tf, dt, initial_conditions=None, solver='dopri5', verbose=False)¶

dFBA() is a alias for dFBAm(). It is intended to provide legacy support for the name “dFBA”

framed.bioreactor.dfba.dFBA_combination(organisms, bioreactors, t0, tf, dt, initial_conditions=None, solver='dopri5', verbose=False)¶

Run dFBA for all possible combinations of the given organisms and reactors.

For example, given two organisms “ecoli” and “scerevisiae”, and two reactors “batch” and “fedbatch”, the call dFBA_combination([ecoli, scerevisiae], [batch, fedbatch], t0, ft, dt] will perform four simulations:

  1. ecoli in batch
  2. ecoli in fedbatch
  3. scerevisiae in batch
  4. scerevisiae in fedbtach
Parameters:
  • organisms – list of Organism
  • bioreactors – list of Bioreactor
  • t0 (float) – initial time
  • tf (float) – final time
  • dt (float) – time step
  • initial_conditions (list of float) – the initial conditions in the order of V0, X0, S0 (default: None)
  • solver (str) – ODE solver. (default: ‘dopri5’)
  • verbose (bool) – Verbosity control. (default: False).
Returns:

a dictionary of dfba results
Return type:

result (OrderedDict)
framed.bioreactor.dfba.dFBAm(bioreactor, t0, tf, dt, initial_conditions=None, solver='dopri5', verbose=False)¶

Dynamic Flux Balance Analysis with Multi-organism support

Parameters:
  • bioreactor (Bioreactor) – a bioreactor instance with defined organisms and metabolites
  • t0 (float) – initial time
  • tf (float) – final time
  • dt (float) – time step
  • initial_conditions (list of float) – the initial conditions in the order of V0, X0, S0 (default: None)
  • solver (str) – ODE solver. (default: ‘dopri5’)
  • verbose (bool) – Verbosity control. (default: False).
Returns:

simulation results
Return type:

results (OrderedDict)

framed.bioreactor.dyssco module¶

This module implements classes and methods useful for the Dynamic Strain Scanning Optimization strategy

Cite: Kai Zhuang et al. 2013. Dynamic strain scanning optimization: an efficient strain design strategy for balanced yield, titer, and productivity.

@author: Kai Zhuang

framed.bioreactor.dyssco.calculate_performance(strain, bioreactor, r_substrate, r_target, t0, tf, dt, initial_conditions=[], dfba_solver='vode', additional_yields=[], verbose=False, save_dfba_solution=False)¶

calculates the performances of a list of strains in a given bioreactor

Parameters:
  • strain – Organism
  • bioreactor – Bioreactor
  • r_substrate (str) – reaction id of the substrate uptake reaction
  • r_target (str) – reaction id of the target metabolite exchange reaction
  • t0 (float) – initial time
  • tf (float) – final time
  • dt (float) – time step
  • initial_conditions (list (of float)) – the initial conditions in the order of V0, X0, S0 (default: None)
  • dfba_solver (str) – ODE solver. (default: ‘dopri5’)
  • additional_yields (list (of str)) – the reaction ids of the additional yields (yields other than target yield) to be calculated.
  • verbose (bool) – Verbosity control. (default: False).
  • save_dfba_solution (bool) – controls whether dfba solutions are returned (default: False)
Returns:

contains the calculated performance metrics of a strain
Return type:

performance (Dict)
framed.bioreactor.dyssco.calculate_performances(strains, bioreactor, r_substrate, r_target, t0, tf, dt, initial_conditions=[], dfba_solver='dopri5', additional_yields=[], verbose=False, save_dfba_solution=False, func_dfba2yield=None)¶

calculates the performances of a list of strains in a given bioreactor

Parameters:
  • strains – list (of Organism)
  • bioreactor – Bioreactor
  • r_substrate (str) – reaction id of the substrate uptake reaction
  • r_target (str) – reaction id of the target metabolite exchange reaction
  • t0 (float) – initial time
  • tf (float) – final time
  • dt (float) – time step
  • initial_conditions (list (of float)) – the initial conditions in the order of V0, X0, S0 (default: None)
  • dfba_solver (str) – ODE solver. (default: ‘dopri5’)
  • additional_yields (list (of str)) – the reaction ids of the additional yields (yields other than target yield) to be calculated.
  • verbose (bool) – Verbosity control. (default: False).
  • save_dfba_solution (bool) – controls whether dfba solutions are returned (default: False)
  • func_dfba2yield (function) – if None, yield is calculated from FBA solutions. if a function is passed in, yield is calculated from dFBA solutions.
Returns:

a list of dictionaries, each entry contains the calculated performance metrics of a strain
Return type:

performances (list (of Dict))
framed.bioreactor.dyssco.make_envelope_strains(base_organism, r_substrate, r_target, N=10, constraints=None)¶
Create N strains along the product envelope.
(Used for Steps 1 and 2 of DySScO strategy)
Parameters:
  • base_organism (Organism) – the host organism used to product the target product
  • r_substrate (str) – the rxn id of the substrate
  • r_target (str) – the rxn id of the target product
  • N (int) – the number of strains to be generated along the production envelope
  • constraints (dict) – custom constraints
Returns:

N strains that are fixed to the production envelope
Return type:

strains (list of Organism)
